ratings.comment: Overall, a good, fair teacher. Public Policy is a rather dry subject, so don't expect too much out of the lectures but if you have some previous knowledge of polisci it shouldn't be too hard. There is a lot of reading but you don't really need to do it all to do well on the test. Be prepared for a 15 page paper though.

Witte is a great guy with a lot of knowledge backed up by his hears of experience in the field.  Sometimes he may seem like a rambler but even though he is talking about himself he is really teaching you through his mistakes.  Very helpful in office hours and really wants everyone to succeed.  This class is a lot of reading but its not very hard.
Very knowledgable and very fair.  People who complain about him generally don't care about public policy anyway.  Would recommend this course to any Poli Sci major.

This is just a mediocre class.  The last comment is correct: you basically read the public policy textbook and have Witte regurgitate it for you, followed by him talking about his experience.  This isn't bad when it pertains, but he sometimes goes off on long tangents that make it hard to stay awake.  Moral of story: take at your own risk.

Taking 219 basically means reading the assigned chapters to learn the ins and outs of Public Policy, followed by going to two power lectures a week and listening to Witte talk about his accomplishments the whole time.
A good professor but overated. Very helpful and knowlegeable. Adds humor but the actual presentation of the material is often bland and not especially well organized.

Very knowledgeable and experienced but he could use some work on clarifying the important points. He has lots of funny stories, some of which are relevant and some of which aren't. Basically, he's old and doesn't care what other people or the university thinks; he just loves policy.

Wow Witte is really a terrible professor.  He constantly rambles and wavers off subject about topics that would only interest policy specialists.  The tests are knit-picky and lectures are long winded and un-relevant to the extremely circumnavigating text.  I would not recommend Witte as he has been the word Poli Sci professor I have taken so far

A great professor, but not as good as everyone else says. If you're looking for a class that really challenges you to think, I wouldn't take one of Witte's classes. He is very helpful and very knowledgeable. Very fair tests.
Interesting class, fair exams, fun prof!  I wish I could find another class he taught.
One of the best lecturers i've had. funny guy, good stories, very smart. tests were fair too. helpful whenever you want him to be.

He knows his stuff. When he seems like he's just talking about how great he is, he's really actually imparting what he knows from his many experiences with education and school choice. I loved this class!
